questions.question_text: Which statement about the Diffie-Hellman Key Agreement is true?

discussion.content: Actually not true, if you take into account EC-related groups https://www.watchguard.com/help/docs/help-center/en-US/Content/en-US/Fireware/bovpn/manual/diffie_hellman_c.html

choices.B: The higher the Diffie-Hellman group number indicates a larger key size.
choices.C: The higher the Diffie-Hellman group number indicates no difference in processing requirements.
choices.D: The higher the Diffie-Hellman group number indicates a smaller prime number (p).
choices.A: The higher the Diffie-Hellman group number indicates a smaller key size.

questions.question_text: Which two activities are examples of social engineering? (Choose two.)

choices.E: receiving an unexpected email from an unknown person with an uncharacteristic attachment from someone in the same company
choices.B: receiving an invite to your departmentâ€™s weekly WebEx meeting
choices.D: receiving an email from HR requesting that you visit the secure HR website and update your contract information
choices.A: receiving call from the IT department asking you to verify your username/password to maintain the account
choices.C: sending a verbal request to an administrator to change the password to the account of a user the administrator does know

discussion.content:
For me is A and C
Key concepts: verbal communication, asking for credentials.
Social Engineering is normally done by convincing the victim, what is easier to do with synchronous conversations.
E is wrong. E is phishing.

OK for A but I disagree with E. For me E is a spam.
I'd rather answer D.

choices.A: Both parties calculate an authenticated MD5 hash value of the data accompanying the message - one party uses the private key, while the other party uses the public key.
choices.B: Both parties to the communication use the same secret key to produce a message authentication code to accompany the message.
choices.D: Both parties obfuscate the data with XOR and a known key before and after transmission of the message.
choices.C: Both parties calculate a CRC32 of the data before and after transmission of the message.

questions.question_text: Which one of the following methods allows you to verify entity authentication, data integrity, and authenticity of communications, without encrypting the actual data?

DRAG DROP -
Drag the data source on the left to the correct data type on the right.
Select and Place:

discussion.content: Wireshark = Full packet capture; Netflow = session data ; server log = transaction data ; = IPS = alert data

Blue1 = Yellow3
Blue2 = Yellow1
Blue3 = Yellow4
Blue4 = Yellow2

questions.question_text: Which regulation specifically addresses credit card compliance?

discussion.content: I think the wording of the question is the key here; PCI-DSS is an industry standard, where Safe Harbor Act is the regulation

comments.content: Safe Harbor Act is a regulation where as PCI DSS is a standard. I agree with C. Safe Harbor Act

discussion.content: PCI DSS should be the answer
